titles.title: A bill for the relief of John M. Gill.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on The Judiciary. Report No: 100-151.
Called up by House on Call of Private Calendar.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1096.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 1/7/1987--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to pay a specified sum to a named individual in full satisfaction of all claims against the United States for personal property losses resulting from the fall of Saigon, Vietnam, in 1975.
